attributes.action: Free parking for mental health nurses working at Queen Elizabeth Hospital A&E
attributes.additional_details: I would like the government/parliament to ensure that front line mental health nurses working for 24hrs/365 days a year; have free parking within Queen Elizabeth Hospital-Woolwich grounds as this will reduce risks associated with their line of work. Driving is essential for most of us as efficiency in reducing A & E waiting times is further improved creating patient care satisfaction. Free parking must NOT end after COVID19 lockdown otherwise, all our efforts appears to have been pointless!
attributes.background: Following the COVID19 lockdown, all nurses/NHS staff were given this "special treatment" which included free parking borough wide and at their respective hospital or sites they worked in. Unfortunately,this seems to have ended & parking fines currently enforced at the huge hospital's parking spaces.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Make parking for all NHS staff free all of the time: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/307909
